alert.note: Alert for Dubois; Orange (Indiana) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued June 01 at 5:46PM EDT by NWS Louisville
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of northeastern Dubois and west central Orange Counties through 615 PM EDT... At 546 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm 10 miles south of Shoals, moving east at 15 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts of 50 to 55 mph and penny size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. This storm will remain over mainly rural areas of west central Orange and northeastern Dubois Counties, including the following locations... Hillham, Thales, Cuzco, Dubois Crossroads, Norton, French Lick Municipal Airport, French Lick, Kellerville and Crystal. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.75 IN MAX WIND GUST...55 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with this storm. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle.
